translation: "I have shown compassion for the sovereign who holds the land, for Rāhmanī, for Kebakinbala, for Gautama Mahāmucilinda, for Nandha and Nandha the Younger, for those who live by water, for sentient beings who walk and dwell in the land, and for all the dragons. I have shown compassion for all humans, gods, gods, ghosts, and sentient beings, all of whom attain well-being, are always rejoicing in the absence of illness, and are good in what they see and don't encounter enmity. I have shown compassion for all poisonous hazards, so don't let them harm me. The Bhagavān, the great compassionate father, speaks truly.
